meanings.definition: To crush or press into wrinkles or folds
meanings.sent1: She was crumpling the paper into a tiny ball.
meanings.sent2: The old newspaper was crumpling in his hands.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed crumpling up the tissue paper for fun.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of success were slowly crumpling before his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The sound of crumpling leaves underfoot filled the forest.

meanings.sent1: The cardboard box was crumpling under the weight of the books.
meanings.sent2: The bridge was crumpling under the force of the flood.
meanings.sent3: The plan started crumpling as soon as they encountered the first obstacle.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was crumpling like a sandcastle against the waves of doubt.
meanings.sent5: The building was crumpling down, causing chaos in the city.

meanings.sent1: The fabric was crumpling after being packed in the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: His shirt was crumpling at the sleeves from being worn all day.
meanings.sent3: The map kept crumpling every time he tried to fold it back up.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be crumpling the once smooth surface of the statue.
meanings.sent5: The heat was crumpling the edges of the painting, giving it a vintage look.
